Subjective: Headache, 2 months, worsening; right-sided, sometimes bilateral; nausea, no vomiting; glare, no flashes; prefers dark room; no fever, no cough, no shortness of breath; no recent stress; occasional alcohol use, no smoking, no drugs; family history of migraines and cluster headaches; impact on daily life: unable to play volleyball, scuba dive, or participate in social activities; Request: wants to know cause and best course of action; worried about migraines or cluster headaches.
Objective: BP 120/80; pulse 50/min; cranial nerves intact; fingertip-nose test good; arm and leg strength good; Romberg's normal; gait slightly off; no other abnormalities.
Assessment: Probable migraine; ruled out cluster headaches; no signs of serious underlying conditions.
Plan: Start pain relief (paracetamol, ibuprofen) as soon as symptoms start
Keep headache diary to track symptoms and identify patterns
Return in 4 weeks for follow-up, or sooner if symptoms worsen or change
Monitor for factors that make symptoms worse (e.g. stress, coffee)
